## Welcome

JAB Lab focuses on understanding human cognition through rigorous experimental methods and advanced analytics. We explore questions at the intersection of cognitive psychology, neuroscience, and real-world behavior.

## Research Interests

- Cognitive processes in naturalistic contexts
- Ecological Momentary Assessment (EMA) methodologies
- Team performance and individual development
- Language, memory, and motivation
- Computational approaches to psychological data

## About

I'm a cognitive psychologist with expertise in experimental design, statistical modeling, and data science. My work bridges laboratory research and applied settings, with a focus on capturing cognition as it unfolds in real time.

**Background:**
- PhD in Cognitive Psychology (Cognitive Neuroscience concentration)
- BA in Psychology and English Literature, Purchase College (Summa Cum Laude)
- Experience in EMA research (Saul Shiffman's lab, University of Pittsburgh)
- Founder of a digital platform company using SMS-based assessment for team and individual performance

**Methods & Tools:**
- Statistical modeling (GLM tradition)
- R, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL
- Experimental design and psychometrics
- Text-based data collection systems
